body:
$AAPL If you need an indicator for a breakout just check stocktwits sentiment. If it falls under 70% the stock breaks out to new ATH. 
 
Keep being dumb ST.

$SPY $AAPL $FB  HIGHER DOLLAR most  Q4 = less money from foreign facebookers, AR Peeeeee ewwwwwU. And December bad for u.s. folks, lower dollar. 

Dump this social experiment

$SPY $QQQ $AMD $AAPL  Oil higher, dollar lower, let's gooooooo, Bufffffalo!!!!!!

Some good NFLs today and yesterday, eh, boys, and, ladies, two, to be exact, aye. 
Gees, wild card games all about money, mostly were blowouts.
I expect the Rams to throttle Cards tom. too. 

Oh, MARKETS, yeah, them, inflation looks raw, even though it's ramped 3 months now,.experts saying supply chain disruptions and shortages of tech stuff, phones, semiconductor chips, food, eyc. to continue to Oct. 2022.

Well, ok, I guess, next major indicator will be PCE Core Deflator.

4.2% August
4.4% Sept.
5.1% Oct.
5.7% Nov.

Looks like it is going to push rates to higher and higher #s, more volatile than CPI. 
 FED uses PCE for funds target rate, you know, 2%😂😅

The HIGH DOLLAR most of Q4 tough on U.S. tech companies because a lot of their profits from overseas foreign folk.

What might be just as concerning is dollar dropped most of the holiday shopping season so U.S. consumers money buying less December.

$AAPL $TSLA $PTON  I'm revising my PT here based on a price increase as demand is falling. Clearly, PTON management slept throughout all economics classes. 

New PT: $10 ($3 billion MC)

Ouch. This thing is going to tank.

message.body:
$PTON I noticed that Costco is now selling a poor man's PTON called ProForm. It's $400.

A PTON bike is what? $3,000?

Definitely the start of the slow, agonizing death spiral here. 

I don't think PTON will go out of business. No way. They have a small group of hardcore fans. The same fans that probably love $AAPL and $TSLA . 

I think either Apple, Google, Amazon, or possibly Netflix will buy them out within 12-24 months. 

The stock will probably drop to $20-$25, management will know it's done, and sell to Apple, Google, Amazon, or Netflix for $25-$40 per share.

body: $AAPL was analyzed by 49 analysts. The buy consensus is at 84%. So analysts seem to be very confident about $AAPL. https://www.chartmill.com/stock/quote/AAPL/analyst-ratings?utm_source=stocktwits&utm_medium=ANALYST&utm_content=AAPL&utm_campaign=social_tracking
$TSLA creating there phone version, If that new phone is been release. This can be the big competitor of $AAPL

$AAPL rather then ever coming out with anything new, they’re just gonna add a camera to the same iPhone they’ve made for decades  and remove the USB port from the laptop and make it thinner and slower...

RIGHTTTTTT... zero innovation 

Oh yea and change the charging cord for the iPhone and not include the charging block. So when you buy an iPhone you have no way of charging it...
$AAPL glad we closed tomorrow or we would've seen red. Features are down
$FUBO Whos buying $FUBO ? $AAPL $CMCSA ??
$NEXCF  $AAPL
$AAPL back to green. Easy setup to see.

$SPY $AAPL $QQQ nice try anyone, saying China slowing growth.
 It is faster now, and their retail sales slowing down last few months is due a lot to rising inflation on our high priced tech, since iPhone took over as #1 seller in China news last week😱🔥🚨👀

China beat on GDP and Industrial production, so, good data ON THEIR HOMEFRONT.
With US in an inflation fix, it won't help us any guaranteed because it points to future growth for China and spend on our already expensive products. 
Retail sales missed, but guessing that due in part to inflation, buying mass Apple phones & tech at exhorbitant prices, buying less too cuz so damn expensivev👌
China is GROWING, so there QE will be taken away , Japan too. Kuroda going to have to raise rates soon 👍

$AAPL $FB $MSFT $GOOG $TSLA 

Keep compounding, stay long!!!!!
$SPY $AAPL $TSLA $AMC Compounding interest is a powerful tool for the disciplined
Big Investor Tripled Its AMC Stake and Bought Apple, NIO, and Nikola Stock $amc $aapl $nio https://apple.news/AxQ_qeZlmTS2JGlGRrX0QWQ

links.title: Big Investor Tripled Its AMC Stake and Bought Apple, NIO, and Nikola Stock - Barron's
links.description: A large European asset manager loaded up on volatile stocks in its U.S.-traded investment portfolio. DNB Asset Management more than tripled its investment in movie-theater chain AMC Entertainment Holding (ticker: AMC), and significantly raised investments in Apple (AAPL), Chinese electric-vehicle maker NIO (NIO) and electric-truck maker Nikola (NKLA).

body:
$AAPL It is funny that $GOOGL complained about Apple iMessage “Superiority” while they in the last 20 years had many opportunities to make their own, but instead they just killed them. This website is showing all the apps that Google killed over the years. (Posted originally by AppleInsider).

https://killedbygoogle.com

links.title: Killed by Google
links.description: Killed by Google is the open source list of dead Google products, services, and devices. It serves as a tribute and memorial of beloved services and products killed by Google.

body:
$SPY  Futures showing a direct correlation to perceived weakness, like to see the dollar drop to red and continuance of oil to $84 futures,  for a slam ____.

Plus, you get a load of that data out of China, wow, Goldman Sachs just slashing our growth forecasts attributable hours BEFORE China's release of 🔥 industrial production, GDP data. 
Retail sales s'pose to be 3.9% and was -1.7% , WOW, that is. a. shocker. 
China wasn't buying a lot probably from companies like $AMD $AAPL $SOXX 
This kind of data SHOULD get AMD & Apple to revise 4Q outlooks😱👍

Why You Should Sell Options Instead Of Buying

$TSLA $MRNA $AAPL $FUBO $GME 

 https://www.chartlearning.com/2021/08/types-of-stock-options-plays-strategies.html

links.title: Why You Should Sell Options Instead Of Buying
links.description: It's always been general wisdom that buying options is always a losing game, equivalent to playing the lottery. You are likely to consistently make money as an options trader, selling options rather than buying. The logic goes, if the buyers are losing the money, the seller must be making all the money, right?
